definition[0]: from one side of something to the other
example[0]: the first flight across the Atlantic
example[1]: They ran straight across the road  (=without stopping).
example[3]: We’d got halfway across before Philip realized he’d left his money at home.
definition[1]: towards someone or something on the other side of an area
example[5]: There’s Brendan. Why don’t you go across and say hello?
example[6]: The referee looked across at his linesman before awarding the penalty.
example[7]: He walked across to where I was sitting.
definition[2]: used to say that something exists or reaches from one side of an area to the other
example[8]: a deep crack across the ceiling
example[9]: the only bridge across the river
example[10]: Do you think this shirt is too tight across the shoulders?
example[11]: Someone’s parked right across the entrance to the driveway.
definition[3]: on the opposite side of something
example[12]: My best friend lives across the road.
example[13]: He knew that just across the border lay freedom.
example[14]: Across the street from where we’re standing, you can see the old churchyard.
example[15]: the woman sitting across from me  (=opposite me) on the train
definition[4]: in every part of a country, organization etc
example[16]: a TV series that became popular across five continents
example[17]: Teachers are expected to teach a range of subjects right across the curriculum.
definition[5]: used to show how wide something is
